main event: The report includes two photos of a landscape in Curling East, Newfoundland, taken in April 1949, with annotations suggesting the observation of something unusual in the sky.
interesting points: The annotations on the first photo refer to a 'faded' and 'flamed' object in the sky, indicating a potential UFO sighting.
Handwritten text on the second photo identifies 'Blow-Me-Down Mtn.' and 'Blow-Me-Down Light' as well as the location 'PETRIES N.F.L.D' in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.
The poor quality of the photographs and the old photographic technology used add to the mysterious nature of the reported sightings.
The report is dated February 11, 1949, and includes references to the sighting being in Curling East, Newfoundland.
sighted object: potentially unidentified object in the sky
photographs: yes, the report includes two photographs
